definition: preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: And they preferred hunger and famine to the desecration of the ancestral grave…
sentences.chinese: 他們寧可自己忍飢挨餓也不願褻瀆祖先們的墳塋。

sentences.english: They take a day of sick leave rather than admit to being off because of pet bereavement.
sentences.chinese: 他們寧可請病假而不願承認因爲痛失寵物而請假。

sentences.english: The liberals prefer to sit on the fence while the other parties fight it out.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨寧可抱騎牆態度，坐待其他黨派去鬥爭到底。

sentences.english: Better to live in a desert than with a quarrelsome and ill-tempered wife.
sentences.chinese: 寧可住在曠野，不與爭吵使氣的婦人同住。

sentences.english: I'd rather have seen him gnash his teeth than smile so.
sentences.chinese: 我寧可看他咬牙也不願看這樣的笑。

sentences.english: Better to be alone than in bad pany.
sentences.chinese: 寧可孤單也不交壞朋友。

sentences.english: Better to be alone than in bad company.
sentences.chinese: 寧可孤單也不交壞朋友。

sentences.english: Kitty owned that she had rather stay at home.
sentences.chinese: 吉蒂說她寧可待在家裏。

sentences.english: Will I'm so bored I could watch the shopping channel. At least the hostess is hot.
sentences.chinese: 威爾我無聊到寧可看購物頻道，至少女主持人很辣。

sentences.english: Career experts suggest erring on the side of caution.
sentences.chinese: 職業專家倡議，寧可功於謹嚴也不要大意。

sentences.english: Better an empty purse than an empty head。
sentences.chinese: 寧可錢袋癟，不要腦袋空。

sentences.english: "It's better to overestimate than to underestimate, " he told reporters.
sentences.chinese: “寧可過分估計也不可估計不足，”他告訴記者。

sentences.english: They said they would rather be outlaws a year in Sherwood Forest.
sentences.chinese: 他們說寧可在謝伍德森林裏當一年綠林好漢。

sentences.english: But go ye rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 你們寧可往以色列家迷失了的羊那裏去。

sentences.english: Oddly enough the family preferred to live in the guestroom.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的是，這家人寧可住在客房裏。

sentences.english: Ella: I dunno, I would rather hire someone I know and trust.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道，我寧可找我認識並且信得過的人。

definition: in no way/not in the least/absolutely not
whatever the case/in any event/no matter what/by all possible means
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away
at the minimum/at the very least
